name: Sushi (Raw Fish)
explanation: Raw fish may contain parasites or bacteria like listeria that can harm the baby.
trimester_advice: Avoid throughout pregnancy. Cooked sushi is generally safe.

name: Unpasteurized Cheese
explanation: Soft cheeses made with unpasteurized milk can contain Listeria.
trimester_advice: Avoid soft cheeses like brie, camembert, and feta unless labeled pasteurized.

name: Alcohol
explanation: No amount of alcohol is proven safe during pregnancy.

name: High Mercury Fish
explanation: High levels of mercury can damage the baby's developing nervous system.
trimester_advice: Avoid shark, swordfish, king mackerel, and tilefish.

name: Deli Meat
explanation: Cold cuts can carry Listeria. If you eat them, heat until steaming hot.

name: Caffeine
explanation: Limit intake to 200mg per day (about one 12oz cup of coffee).
trimester_advice: High intake is linked to low birth weight.

name: Salmon (Cooked)
explanation: Excellent source of Omega-3 fatty acids (DHA) which helps brain development.
trimester_advice: Aim for 2-3 servings of low-mercury fish per week.

name: Eggs (Cooked)
explanation: Great source of choline and protein.
trimester_advice: Ensure yolks are fully cooked to avoid Salmonella.

name: Raw Sprouts
explanation: Raw sprouts can contain harmful bacteria like E. coli or Salmonella.

name: Raw Milk
explanation: Raw milk may contain Listeria and other pathogens.
trimester_advice: Choose only pasteurized milk and dairy products.

name: Hot Dogs
explanation: Risk of Listeria unless heated thoroughly.
trimester_advice: Heat until steaming hot before eating.

name: Pepperoni
explanation: Processed meats may carry bacteria unless cooked.
trimester_advice: Safe if cooked on pizza until steaming hot.

name: Smoked Salmon (Cold Smoked)
explanation: Cold smoked fish can carry Listeria.
trimester_advice: Safe only when fully cooked or heated in a dish.

name: Shrimp (Cooked)
explanation: Low mercury and high in protein.

name: Liver
explanation: High in vitamin A which can be harmful in excess.
trimester_advice: Limit or avoid especially in first trimester.

name: Pate
explanation: Often unpasteurized and may contain Listeria.

name: Raw Eggs
trimester_advice: Avoid raw or runny eggs and foods made with them.

name: Mayonnaise (Pasteurized)
explanation: Commercial mayo is pasteurized and safe.
trimester_advice: Avoid homemade mayo with raw eggs.

name: Peanut Butter
trimester_advice: Safe unless you have an allergy.

name: Soft Serve Ice Cream
explanation: Machines can harbor Listeria if not cleaned well.
trimester_advice: Choose packaged ice cream when possible.

name: Raw Cookie Dough
explanation: Contains raw eggs and sometimes raw flour.

name: Raw Flour
explanation: Raw flour can contain E. coli.
trimester_advice: Only eat baked or cooked doughs.

name: Kombucha
explanation: Contains caffeine, alcohol, and unregulated bacteria.

name: Energy Drinks
explanation: Contain very high caffeine and additives.

name: Herbal Tea
explanation: Some herbs are not tested in pregnancy.
trimester_advice: Only consume teas labeled pregnancy safe.

name: Chamomile Tea
trimester_advice: Only drink if approved by a doctor.

name: Green Tea
explanation: Contains caffeine and can interfere with folate absorption.

name: Protein Powder
explanation: Supplements are not regulated and may contain additives.

name: Avocado
explanation: Rich in folate, healthy fats, and fiber.

name: Bananas
explanation: High in potassium which helps with leg cramps.

name: Berries
explanation: High in antioxidants and vitamin C.

name: Pineapple
explanation: Safe during pregnancy. Bromelain content is too low to cause issues.

name: Watermelon
trimester_advice: Great in third trimester for swelling.

name: Papaya (Ripe)
explanation: Ripe papaya is safe and nutritious.

name: Papaya (Unripe)
explanation: Unripe papaya contains latex which may cause contractions.

name: Honey
explanation: Safe for pregnant adults since digestion neutralizes bacteria.
trimester_advice: Avoid giving honey to infants after birth.

name: Tofu
trimester_advice: Fully cook to reduce contamination risk.

name: Kimchi
explanation: Fermented foods can cause stomach issues.

name: Pickles
explanation: Safe and good for cravings, though high sodium.

name: Hummus
explanation: Store bought hummus has a small Listeria risk.
trimester_advice: Choose fresh or heat before eating.

name: Tuna (Canned Light)
explanation: Contains some mercury but lower than tuna steaks.
trimester_advice: Limit to 2 to 3 servings a week.

name: Oysters (Raw)
explanation: Raw oysters can contain Vibrio bacteria.

name: Oysters (Cooked)
explanation: Safe when fully cooked, but may cause digestive issues.

name: Steak (Medium Rare)
explanation: Undercooked meat may contain harmful bacteria.

name: Bacon
trimester_advice: Eat well cooked and in moderation.

name: Prosciutto
explanation: Dry cured meats are not cooked and may contain pathogens.
trimester_advice: Avoid unless fully cooked in dishes.

name: Pancetta
trimester_advice: Safe only when cooked thoroughly in dishes.

name: Salami
explanation: Processed meat with small risk of contamination.

name: Pizza
trimester_advice: Avoid pizzas with raw sprouts or unpasteurized cheeses.

name: White Bread
explanation: Low fiber and causes blood sugar spikes.

name: Pasta
trimester_advice: Choose whole grain for added nutrition.

name: Dark Chocolate
explanation: Contains antioxidants and may boost mood.

name: Frozen Yogurt
explanation: Lower fat alternative to ice cream.

name: Cantaloupe
explanation: Whole melons can carry Listeria on the rind.

name: Carrots
explanation: High in vitamin A but safe in food form.

name: Broccoli
explanation: High in folate, calcium, and fiber.
trimester_advice: Cook lightly or eat raw if washed.

name: Cauliflower
explanation: Rich in vitamins C and K.

name: Kale
trimester_advice: Wash very well to remove bacteria.

name: French Fries
explanation: High in unhealthy fats and salt.

name: Smoothies
explanation: Nutritious if made with pasteurized ingredients.

name: Milkshakes
explanation: High sugar and often made with soft serve.
trimester_advice: Choose shakes made with pasteurized ice cream.

name: Guacamole
explanation: Rich in folate and healthy fats.

name: Soda
explanation: High sugar and may contain caffeine.

name: Swiss Chard
explanation: High in vitamin K and fiber.
trimester_advice: Cook lightly or wash raw leaves well.

name: Sweet Potatoes
explanation: Rich in beta carotene and fiber.

name: Leeks
explanation: Good source of vitamins A and K.

name: Rosemary
trimester_advice: Avoid essential oils but food amounts are safe.

name: Pumpkin
explanation: High in fiber and vitamin A.

name: Chia Seeds
explanation: High in fiber and omega 3 fats.

name: Sesame Seeds
explanation: Nutrient rich seed used in many dishes.

name: Poppy Seeds
explanation: May contain trace opiates from processing.

name: Cashews
explanation: Good source of iron and zinc.

name: Macadamia Nuts
trimester_advice: Eat in moderation due to calories.

name: Lime Juice
explanation: Safe and refreshing source of vitamin C.

name: Tomatoes
explanation: High in vitamin C and lycopene.

name: Oat Milk
explanation: High in fiber and often fortified.

name: Coconut Milk
trimester_advice: Use in cooking or small servings.

name: Rice Milk
explanation: Low protein and may contain arsenic traces.

name: Ricotta
trimester_advice: Use in sweet or savory dishes.

name: Cream Cheese
trimester_advice: Use in moderation due to fat.

name: Blue Cheese (Pasteurized)
explanation: Even pasteurized versions may contain moisture that supports bacteria.

name: Gorgonzola
explanation: Soft cheese with higher bacterial risk.

name: Yogurt Covered Raisins
explanation: High sugar and often contains additives.

name: Raisins
trimester_advice: Eat in moderation due to sugar.

name: Beef Jerky
explanation: Not fully cooked and may contain pathogens.

name: Turkey Jerky
explanation: Drying is not the same as cooking.

name: Nori Sheets
explanation: Safe if iodine intake is monitored.

name: Teriyaki Chicken
explanation: Safe when chicken is cooked fully.
trimester_advice: Be mindful of sugars in sauce.

name: Curry
trimester_advice: Choose mild if sensitive to heartburn.

name: Tikka Masala
explanation: Safe if chicken is fully cooked.
trimester_advice: Watch cream content if lactose sensitive.

name: Shawarma
explanation: Rotisserie meats can harbor bacteria if not heated properly.

name: Gyro Meat
explanation: Rotating meat cones may be unevenly cooked.
trimester_advice: Eat only if freshly shaved and steaming.

name: Yerba Mate
explanation: Contains high caffeine and compounds not recommended.

name: Hot Chocolate
explanation: Contains sugar and small amounts of caffeine.

name: Mango
explanation: High in vitamins A and C.

name: Kiwi
explanation: Rich in vitamin C and fiber.

name: Pomegranate
trimester_advice: Safe to eat seeds or juice.

name: Dates
explanation: May support labor preparation late in pregnancy.

name: Apricots
explanation: Rich in vitamins A and C.

name: Starfruit
explanation: May affect kidney function in sensitive individuals.
trimester_advice: Avoid if you have kidney issues.

name: Electrolyte Powder
explanation: Formulas vary and may contain additives.

name: Eggnog
explanation: Often contains raw eggs and alcohol.
trimester_advice: Avoid unless pasteurized and alcohol free.

name: Protein Bars
explanation: Many contain additives and sugar alcohols.

name: Gummy Vitamins
explanation: May lack full prenatal nutrient profile.

name: Frozen Meals
explanation: Often high in sodium and preservatives.

name: Fish Sticks
explanation: Often made with low quality fish and fried.

name: Lasagna
explanation: Nutritious layered meal when cooked fully.

name: Mashed Potatoes
trimester_advice: Add milk or butter for calories if needed.

name: Tacos
trimester_advice: Avoid raw sprouts or unpasteurized toppings.

name: Burritos
explanation: Nutritious when filled with beans and cooked meats.

name: Burrito Bowls
trimester_advice: Choose brown rice for extra fiber.

name: Black Beans
trimester_advice: Soak or cook well to reduce gas.

name: Risotto
explanation: Hard rice grains are low risk.

name: Deviled Eggs
explanation: Safe if eggs are fully cooked.

name: Egg Drop Soup
explanation: Egg strands may not be fully cooked.

name: Prepackaged Caesar Salad
explanation: Dressings may contain raw eggs and prewashed greens carry slight contamination risk.
trimester_advice: Choose versions with pasteurized dressing and wash greens again if possible.

name: Prepackaged Garden Salad
explanation: Bagged lettuce blends have been associated with recalls for bacteria.
trimester_advice: Wash greens even if labeled triple washed.

name: Prepackaged Spinach Salad
explanation: Prewashed spinach can still contain bacteria.

name: Prepackaged Coleslaw Mix
explanation: Bagged shredded vegetables may carry bacteria if stored poorly.

name: Chick fil A Nuggets
explanation: Fully cooked chicken prepared at high temperature.

name: Chick fil A Sandwich
trimester_advice: Avoid if left sitting too long.

name: Chick fil A Spicy Sandwich
explanation: Fully cooked but may trigger heartburn.

name: Panera Green Goddess Cobb Salad
explanation: Contains deli style chicken and blue cheese.
trimester_advice: Ask for pasteurized cheese only and confirm chicken is freshly cooked.

name: Panera Caesar Salad
explanation: Dressing may contain raw egg and romaine risk is present.
trimester_advice: Request pasteurized dressing and ensure chicken is hot.

name: Panera Autumn Squash Soup
explanation: Fully cooked and smooth soup option.

name: Panera Cinnamon Crunch Bagel
explanation: Baked bread with no pregnancy risks.

name: McDonalds Big Mac
explanation: High fat and sodium but meat is fully cooked.

name: McDonalds Quarter Pounder
explanation: May be served medium cooked depending on store.

name: Chipotle Burrito Bowl
explanation: Ingredients are cooked and generally safe.
trimester_advice: Avoid queso and sofritas if sensitive to spice.

name: Chipotle Burrito
explanation: Warm tortillas with cooked fillings are safe.
trimester_advice: Add lettuce only if washed thoroughly.

name: Olive Garden Salad
explanation: Contains raw vegetables that may not be washed thoroughly.
trimester_advice: Ask for fresh bowl and wash greens if possible.

name: Chipotle Chicken
trimester_advice: Choose mild toppings if heartburn is an issue.

name: Chinese Takeout Fried Rice
explanation: Often includes leftover rice that may not be cooled properly.

name: Chinese Takeout Lo Mein
explanation: Stir fried noodles with cooked ingredients.
trimester_advice: Avoid bean sprouts unless cooked well.

name: Sushi Rolls (Fully Cooked)
explanation: Safe when containing cooked seafood or vegetables.
trimester_advice: Avoid imitation crab if sensitive to additives.

name: California Roll
explanation: Contains imitation crab that is cooked.
trimester_advice: Eat fresh and avoid grocery store sushi sitting out.

name: Shrimp Tempura Roll
trimester_advice: Eat in moderation due to frying.

name: Jimmy Johns Sandwich
explanation: Cold deli meats may contain Listeria.
trimester_advice: Heat meat to steaming before eating.

name: Subway Chicken Teriyaki
explanation: Chicken is heated prior to serving.

name: Subway Tuna Sandwich
explanation: Contains mayonnaise and tuna with variable mercury.

name: Wendys Baked Potato
explanation: Simple cooked potato with no risks.

name: Popeyes Chicken Sandwich
trimester_advice: Limit due to high fat content.

name: Buffalo Wild Wings Traditional Wings
explanation: Deep fried wings are fully cooked.
trimester_advice: Choose mild sauces if prone to heartburn.

name: Papa Johns Pizza
explanation: Fully baked pizza with pasteurized cheese.
trimester_advice: Avoid toppings like cold cured meats.

name: Dominos Pizza
explanation: All toppings are cooked in oven.
trimester_advice: Choose vegetable or cooked meat toppings.

name: Little Caesars Pizza
explanation: High heat baking makes it safe.
trimester_advice: Avoid cold toppings added after baking.

name: Five Guys Burger
explanation: All burgers are cooked well done by default.

name: Five Guys Fries
explanation: Fried in oil with high fat content.

name: Steakhouse Baked Potato
trimester_advice: Add cheese or butter for calories if needed.

name: Steakhouse Caesar Salad
explanation: Contains raw egg dressing and raw greens.

name: Waffle House Hashbrowns
trimester_advice: Ensure they are cooked crispy throughout.

name: Waffle House Waffle
explanation: Fully cooked batter with no risk.

name: Starbucks Banana Bread
explanation: Baked bread with no raw ingredients.

name: Starbucks Sandwich
explanation: All sandwiches are heated before serving.

name: Smoothie King Smoothie
trimester_advice: Choose pregnancy safe menu items only.

name: Fresh Juice Bar Smoothie
explanation: High contamination risk from blenders and raw produce.

name: Grocery Store Rotisserie Chicken
trimester_advice: Eat hot and do not store at room temperature.

name: Arbys Roast Beef Sandwich
explanation: Meat slices may not always reach steaming hot temperature.

name: Qdoba Burrito Bowl
explanation: Ingredients are served hot and cooked.
trimester_advice: Ask for lettuce to be freshly washed.

name: Panda Express Orange Chicken
explanation: Fried and coated in sugary sauce.

name: Zaxbys Grilled Chicken Salad
explanation: Includes raw greens that may not be washed well.

name: Raising Canes Chicken Fingers
explanation: Chicken is fried to safe temperature.

name: Applebees House Salad
explanation: Raw greens carry low but present contamination risk.

name: Chilis Quesadilla Explosion Salad
explanation: Contains raw greens and heavy dressing.

name: Outback Alice Springs Chicken
explanation: Chicken is fully cooked with pasteurized cheese.

name: Outback Baked Potato Soup
explanation: Soup is fully cooked and hot.

name: Cheesecake Factory Pasta Da Vinci
explanation: Cooked pasta and chicken are safe.

name: Starbucks Sous Vide Egg White Bites
Pizzeria Veggie Pizza
explanation: Oven baked pizza with fully cooked toppings.

name: Bigeye tuna
explanation: Bigeye tuna contains high mercury levels that can harm fetal brain and nervous system development.

name: King mackerel
explanation: King mackerel contains high mercury and should be completely avoided during pregnancy.

name: Marlin
explanation: Marlin is a high mercury fish and poses risks to fetal development.
trimester_advice: Do not consume at any stage of pregnancy.

name: Anchovies
explanation: Anchovies may carry bacteria if not fully cooked.

name: Black sea bass
explanation: Black sea bass may contain moderate mercury levels.

name: Catfish
explanation: Catfish may contain environmental contaminants depending on source.
trimester_advice: Consume in moderation and ensure it is fully cooked.

name: Freshwater trout
explanation: Freshwater trout is generally low mercury but should still be cooked thoroughly.
trimester_advice: Eat cooked only and limit to moderate intake.

name: Herring
explanation: Herring is safe only when cooked due to risk of parasites.

name: Pollock
explanation: Pollock is generally low mercury but must be cooked thoroughly.

name: Ceviche
explanation: Ceviche is made with raw seafood which can contain parasites and harmful bacteria.

name: Lox
explanation: Refrigerated lox can contain listeria which is dangerous during pregnancy.
trimester_advice: Avoid unless cooked until steaming hot.

name: Ham salad
explanation: Ready made ham salad can contain listeria.

name: Tuna salad
explanation: Prepared tuna salad can harbor bacteria when stored cold.

name: Chicken salad
explanation: Pre made chicken salad can carry listeria.

name: Unpasteurized milk
explanation: Unpasteurized milk can contain listeria, E. coli, and salmonella.

name: Unpasteurized juice
explanation: Unpasteurized juice can contain harmful bacteria.

name: Unpasteurized cider
explanation: Unpasteurized cider can harbor bacteria like E. coli.

name: Unpasteurized soft cheeses
explanation: These cheeses can contain listeria which can lead to miscarriage or stillbirth.
trimester_advice: Avoid fully unless cooked until steaming hot.

name: Unpasteurized cream
explanation: Unpasteurized dairy can contain dangerous bacteria.

name: Alfalfa sprouts
explanation: Sprouts can carry salmonella and E. coli inside the seed where washing cannot reach.
trimester_advice: Avoid all raw sprouts during pregnancy.

name: Clover sprouts
explanation: Clover sprouts may carry harmful bacteria.

name: Radish sprouts
explanation: Radish sprouts can contain bacteria and should not be eaten raw.

name: Mung bean sprouts
explanation: Mung bean sprouts often carry harmful bacteria.

name: Margarine
explanation: May contain trans fats which are unhealthy during pregnancy.

name: Butter
explanation: High in saturated fat and should be consumed sparingly.

name: Palm oil
explanation: Palm oil is high in saturated fat.

name: Heavy cream
explanation: Heavy cream has high saturated fat content.

name: Sour cream
explanation: Contains saturated fat which should be limited.

name: Donuts
explanation: High in sugar and unhealthy fats.

name: Pastries
explanation: Pastries contain added sugars and saturated fats.

name: Liver
explanation: Liver is extremely high in vitamin A which can cause birth defects.

name: Prosciutto
explanation: Cured meats may carry listeria unless cooked.

name: Chorizo
explanation: Chorizo is safe only when cooked thoroughly.

name: Pepperoni
explanation: Pepperoni may carry bacteria when eaten cold.
trimester_advice: Eat only when heated until steaming hot.

name: Salami
explanation: Salami should be eaten only when fully cooked due to bacteria risk.
